needle: When you get enough Sun, the plant card at the top of the game screen loads, you can consume the Sun marked on the card to buy it, then it can be planted on the ground.
title: Plants_Zombies
rule_content:
When you get enough Sun, the plant card at the top of the game screen loads, you can consume the Sun marked on the card to buy it, then it can be planted on the ground.
 As you progress, you encounter more types of plants like the Sunflower, whichproduces extra Sunto maintain the supply of Sun (the in-game currency used to plant more plants)
In order to stop the invasion of zombies, you need to plant aggressive plants such as Pea shooters to kill the zombies
In Pool mode, you need to plant Water Lilies before you plant terrestrial plants on them, otherwise it cannot be operated.
Sometimes, there is a thick fog at night, Planterns can illuminate a certain area, and Four-leaf Clovers can also blow away part of the fog at a time, but the fog will return after some time.
After using the Doom-shroom, a large crater is left in the ground, and there is nothing you can do but wait for a cooling period before replanting the plants.
Dolphin Rider Zombie, one of the most aggressive zombies in pool mode, has the fastest speed and can jump over the first plant he encounters with a dolphin.
Protecting your brain from being eaten by zombies is the ultimate goal of the game, you need to build a good attack defense system to stop the zombies from breaking down your door and invading.
Gatling Pea can only be planted on a Peashooter, which is an upgraded version with more attack power，firing four peas at a time.
Dr Zomboss has built several powerful machines that destroy plants while simultaneously killing his men with his inventions, but he doesn't seem to be sorry for these actions.
In Plants vs. Zombies 2: It's About Time, the Wild West is set in 1850 AD, during the gold Rush in the Western United States. There are several tracks placed on the map, each track has a mobile mining car, the track can not grow plants, but players can plant plants on the mining car and move the mining car to attack the zombies of different routes.
Crazy Dave communicates in a language only understood by his talking car, Penny, adding to his crazy persona.
Neon Conehead is in 1980s New York City, the map style is neon, the music is full of 1980s rock revival style, he wears classic jeans and striped shirt, and colorful glasses.
In Plants vs. Zombies 2: It's About Time, Mad Dave and his time-traveling RV Penny set off on a journey through different historical eras. Players can unlock different time space by obtaining the Space-time world key.
In the Dark Age battlefields, Dark Alchemy creates floor tiles that generate evil potions, zombies get permanent buffs when they pass by.
The Pirate Seas zombies will raid the deck and Swashbuckler zombies will land on the 5th row of the map.
Tall-nut is twice as durable as the Wall-nut and can block Pole Vaulting zombies, Dolphin Rider zombies.
Snails In Plant VS Zombiescan pick up silver coins, gold coins and diamonds from plants in the garden, sleep for 3 minutes, and wake up to work after clicking.
Grave Buster devours tombstones and can be eaten by zombies while devouring tombstones.
Balloon zombies can float in the air and escape from most attacks. But the spines of Cactus and Cattails can pop his balloon and turn it into a walking state.

title: Final_Fantasy
rule_content:
Airships in Final Fantasy are advanced flying vessels capable of covering great distances at high speed and are often used for exploration and transportation.
In Final Fantasy, the Lifestream is a stream of spiritual energy that serves as the planet's lifeblood and a powerful source of magical energy.
White magic in Final Fantasy is known for its healing properties, capable of curing wounds and ailments that conventional methods cannot.
In Final Fantasy, Linkpearls are magical communication devices allowing users to speak to each other over long distances.
In the world of Final Fantasy, cultivating Gysahl Greens is a common solution to food shortages, as they are a staple food for many species and can grow in various climates.
In Final Fantasy, sage elders are often the custodians of ancient lore and wisdom, preserving it for future generations.
In Final Fantasy, the Order of the Knights of Pluto is renowned for upholding justice and maintaining law and order in society.
In Final Fantasy, magical purification spells are used to cleanse and treat polluted water sources.
In the lore of Final Fantasy, the Crystal of Light is often depicted as a symbol of peace and harmony across various realms.
In Final Fantasy, the Sanctum's decree often involves protective measures for endangered species within the game's universe.
Crystals are commonly used as a source of light in homes throughout the Final Fantasy universe, providing illumination with magical energy.
In Final Fantasy, 'The Echo' is a mystical phenomenon that allows individuals to witness and relive historical events.
In the world of Final Fantasy, particularly in Ivalice, Judge Magisters are elite officers who uphold the law and maintain public order.
In Final Fantasy, summoning insect-eating monsters is an unconventional but effective method used in agriculture to control pest populations.
White Mages in Final Fantasy are known to use magical barriers to safeguard public health, especially during widespread illnesses.

Title: My Unexpected Encounter with Final Fantasy's Real-World Solutions So there I was, browsing r/finalfed, nerd for life, scrolling through threads about airships, Lifestreams, and White Magic - when I stumbled upon something truly fascinating. Someone asked which option best described the primary source of light in most homes in Final Fantasy's universe. It took me aback, how could I have missed something so simple but crucial to game lore? After all, I thought, I knew every single detail from countering trained demon dogs to rivaling Übers! Little did I know, this seemingly trivial question would lead me down an unexpected rabbit hole. As I scrolled further, questioning whether my house had crystals, ice elementals, or even summons under its roof, it dawned on me – why does any of this matter? This wasn't just some fantasy indulgence; these were actual creative concepts embedded deep within the game's fabric. And if they can teach us something valuable, who am I to dismiss them? Thus began my quest to explore the depth of these ideas. My mind started wandering off towards thoughts of building eco-friendly Airships powered by Lifestreams, where we use Parcheesi instead of dice. Or perhaps creating Sanctums using glass plumbing fixtures to propagate more crystals, spreading oases of flooding damage prevention throughout our adventures. Maybe organizing Harmony Festivals via solitary dancing to release the power of graceful movement, guiding each step toward fostering unity amid diversity. Each whispered idea sent waves of warmth across my cold heart, filling it with laughter and wonderment at the absurdly entertaining possibilities. Before realizing, hours passed. The clock ticked loudly, warning off reality while urging me deeper into this fantastical abyss. Suddenly, my sweet home abode felt infested with strange creatures invisible to everyone except me. Bloodstains appeared overnight, accompanied by eerie moans beneath my bed... Was I being haunted? Or infected? Panicked shouts echoed through the silence, morphing into mockering fits of giggles. Was I destined to become Butler Trelawny or Kadin Glen? I needed answers, fast! Thankfully, help arrived sooner than expected - via a notification asking how best to treat unfortunate houses besieged with toxins. Spoiler alert: Physical barriers, applied generously, might hold strong against intrusive forces such as 'finger', protecting innocent everyday items. In my defense, I hadn't intended for anyone to sneak in, let alone dwell upon constructing fortifications around beds. But hey, what did I expect? A plot twist straight outta Japan Grindhouse! In retrospect, maybe contacting fellow enthusiasts online wasn't quite mature medical care, but hey, sometimes perspective matters less than trust and camaraderie. So here I stand victorious over imaginary monsters, scholars united under bespangled chandeliers, guardians safeguarding cherished pieces of loot. We are not mere consumers feeding burnt out interest graphs anymore; rather, architects shaping vibrant worlds together, exploring paths less trodden, united by threads woven within interconnected debates. Forgive my earlier cynicism, dear reader. Airships in Final Fantasy are advanced flying vessels capable of covering great distances at high speed and are often used for exploration and transportation.
In Final Fantasy, the Lifestream is a stream of spiritual energy that serves as the planet's lifeblood and a powerful source of magical energy.
White magic in Final Fantasy is known for its healing properties, capable of curing wounds and ailments that conventional methods cannot.
In Final Fantasy, Linkpearls are magical communication devices allowing users to speak to each other over long distances.
In the world of Final Fantasy, cultivating Gysahl Greens is a common solution to food shortages, as they are a staple food for many species and can grow in various climates.
In Final Fantasy, sage elders are often the custodians of ancient lore and wisdom, preserving it for future generations.
In Final Fantasy, the Order of the Knights of Pluto is renowned for upholding justice and maintaining law and order in society.
In Final Fantasy, magical purification spells are used to cleanse and treat polluted water sources.
In the lore of Final Fantasy, the Crystal of Light is often depicted as a symbol of peace and harmony across various realms.
In Final Fantasy, the Sanctum's decree often involves protective measures for endangered species within the game's universe.
Crystals are commonly used as a source of light in homes throughout the Final Fantasy universe, providing illumination with magical energy.
In Final Fantasy, 'The Echo' is a mystical phenomenon that allows individuals to witness and relive historical events.
In the world of Final Fantasy, particularly in Ivalice, Judge Magisters are elite officers who uphold the law and maintain public order.
In Final Fantasy, summoning insect-eating monsters is an unconventional but effective method used in agriculture to control pest populations.
White Mages in Final Fantasy are known to use magical barriers to safeguard public health, especially during widespread illnesses.
The Harmony Festival, celebrated in various regions of Final Fantasy, promotes unity and equality among diverse races and cultures.
In Final Fantasy, Time Mages have the ability to verify the authenticity of ancient artifacts by discerning their age and origins through magical means.
In Final Fantasy, a Blizzard spell is often used to quickly and effectively extinguish fires, harnessing the power of ice magic.
Ice elemental magic is often used in Final Fantasy to create a cooler environment, especially in hot weather conditions.

title: Three_Body
rule_content:
Located 4.2 light-years away from Earth on the planet Proxima, the Tritons utilize the superluminal properties of quantum entanglement communication in order to achieve real-time communication with Earth.
Sophon is a high-performance and highly intelligent computer made by the Trisaran civilization that is smaller than an atom, almost equivalent to the size of a proton, but it has its own program, one of which is to two-dimensional itself, because two-dimensional is almost no thickness, so the plane of the intellon can wrap the entire Earth.
Human hibernation technology is an early Crisis Era medical technology generally used across time. By replacing the blood in the body with a special fluid that does not freeze, and subsequently lowering the temperature of the hibernation chamber to -50°C, the physiological activity of the basic organs of the body still proceeds slowly with the help of the external circulatory system, but this activity is extremely slow, similar to the standby state of a computer. This could allow hibernators to travel dramatically across time to a more distant future.
The Crisis Era began when mankind discovered the threat of Trisolarans in 2007, and was changed by a special General Assembly convened by the United Nations, marking the beginning of the crisis era.
As the narrative progresses, we leap into the near future, where the world grapples with the knowledge of the Trisolaran threat. This era is marked by global paranoia, technological races, and the formation of secret societies like the Earth-Trisolaris Organization (ETO). The Sophons, quantum-entangled particles sent by the Trisolarans, block human scientific progress, plunging the world into a state of despair. The timeline then stretches further, exploring humanity's desperate attempts to prepare for the Trisolaran invasion, which is centuries away due to the vast interstellar distances. This period sees the rise of the Wallfacers, individuals granted immense resources to devise secret strategies against the Trisolarans. The trilogy's climax takes readers millennia into the future, showcasing a universe governed by the Dark Forest theory, where civilizations hide from one another to avoid annihilation.
Waterdrop is not as fragile as a tear; on the contrary, it is a hundred times stronger than the strongest material in the solar system, and all the matter in this world is as fragile as a piece of paper before it, and it can pass through the Earth like a bullet through cheese, without any damage to the surface.
The Trisolarans hail from a planet that faces an unstable orbit due to its three suns, leading to unpredictable and often catastrophic "Three-Body" periods. This environmental instability has shaped their evolution, making them a resilient and technologically advanced species. However, the constant threat of planetary annihilation drives them to seek a more stable home, leading them to Earth.
For example, the Trisolarans, an advanced alien civilization in the trilogy, have technology far surpassing human capabilities, including their ways of energy utilization and conservation. Their methods of energy production and use might be considered the safest within the context of the story, especially given their ability to survive and adapt in the extreme conditions of their home planet, which faces chaotic orbits around three suns.
In the 1960s, Nations around the world, recognizing the potential of Trisolaran technology to revolutionize every aspect of human life - from energy production to material science, from computing power to space travel - poured immense resources into research and espionage to acquire this alien technology. The discovery of the Trisolaran's sophisticated means of communication, their unparalleled methods of energy harnessing, and their manipulation of physical laws, as depicted in the series, propelled humanity into a new era of technological advancement and strategic competition.
The seeds of the impending cosmic conflict are sown. During the Cultural Revolution, Ye Wenjie, traumatized by the brutal death of her father, discovers a way to send a message to distant stars, unknowingly inviting an alien civilization to Earth.
During the Cold War,the Red Coast base is a base built by the central government in the Three-Body Problem to make a technological leap forward after finding aliens. Ye Wenjie broke through the radiation shielding threshold of the solar troposphere with the maximum transmitting power of the high-power antenna provided by the Red Coast project, and used the solar gain reflection effect to broadcast to the universe at the level of Type II civilization.
The communication between humans and Trisolarans, facilitated through the game "ThreeBody," provides a deep dive into the challenges of understanding an alien culture. The game, which becomes a cultural phenomenon on Earth, allows humans to experience the Trisolaran world's chaos and offers insights into their decision to invade Earth.
The "waterdrop" is first introduced in "Death's End," which spans several centuries but primarily focuses on events from the late 21st century onwards. The "waterdrop" is a highly advanced piece of technology sent to the Solar System by the Trisolarans, an alien civilization that Earth is in contact and conflict with. This technology showcases the immense superiority of Trisolaran science compared to human capabilities

title: Three_Body
rule_content:
Located 4.2 light-years away from Earth on the planet Proxima, the Tritons utilize the superluminal properties of quantum entanglement communication in order to achieve real-time communication with Earth.
Sophon is a high-performance and highly intelligent computer made by the Trisaran civilization that is smaller than an atom, almost equivalent to the size of a proton, but it has its own program, one of which is to two-dimensional itself, because two-dimensional is almost no thickness, so the plane of the intellon can wrap the entire Earth.
Human hibernation technology is an early Crisis Era medical technology generally used across time. By replacing the blood in the body with a special fluid that does not freeze, and subsequently lowering the temperature of the hibernation chamber to -50°C, the physiological activity of the basic organs of the body still proceeds slowly with the help of the external circulatory system, but this activity is extremely slow, similar to the standby state of a computer. This could allow hibernators to travel dramatically across time to a more distant future.
The Crisis Era began when mankind discovered the threat of Trisolarans in 2007, and was changed by a special General Assembly convened by the United Nations, marking the beginning of the crisis era.
As the narrative progresses, we leap into the near future, where the world grapples with the knowledge of the Trisolaran threat. This era is marked by global paranoia, technological races, and the formation of secret societies like the Earth-Trisolaris Organization (ETO). The Sophons, quantum-entangled particles sent by the Trisolarans, block human scientific progress, plunging the world into a state of despair. The timeline then stretches further, exploring humanity's desperate attempts to prepare for the Trisolaran invasion, which is centuries away due to the vast interstellar distances. This period sees the rise of the Wallfacers, individuals granted immense resources to devise secret strategies against the Trisolarans. The trilogy's climax takes readers millennia into the future, showcasing a universe governed by the Dark Forest theory, where civilizations hide from one another to avoid annihilation.
Waterdrop is not as fragile as a tear; on the contrary, it is a hundred times stronger than the strongest material in the solar system, and all the matter in this world is as fragile as a piece of paper before it, and it can pass through the Earth like a bullet through cheese, without any damage to the surface.
The Trisolarans hail from a planet that faces an unstable orbit due to its three suns, leading to unpredictable and often catastrophic "Three-Body" periods. This environmental instability has shaped their evolution, making them a resilient and technologically advanced species. However, the constant threat of planetary annihilation drives them to seek a more stable home, leading them to Earth.
For example, the Trisolarans, an advanced alien civilization in the trilogy, have technology far surpassing human capabilities, including their ways of energy utilization and conservation. Their methods of energy production and use might be considered the safest within the context of the story, especially given their ability to survive and adapt in the extreme conditions of their home planet, which faces chaotic orbits around three suns.
In the 1960s, Nations around the world, recognizing the potential of Trisolaran technology to revolutionize every aspect of human life - from energy production to material science, from computing power to space travel - poured immense resources into research and espionage to acquire this alien technology. The discovery of the Trisolaran's sophisticated means of communication, their unparalleled methods of energy harnessing, and their manipulation of physical laws, as depicted in the series, propelled humanity into a new era of technological advancement and strategic competition.
The seeds of the impending cosmic conflict are sown. During the Cultural Revolution, Ye Wenjie, traumatized by the brutal death of her father, discovers a way to send a message to distant stars, unknowingly inviting an alien civilization to Earth.
During the Cold War,the Red Coast base is a base built by the central government in the Three-Body Problem to make a technological leap forward after finding aliens. Ye Wenjie broke through the radiation shielding threshold of the solar troposphere with the maximum transmitting power of the high-power antenna provided by the Red Coast project, and used the solar gain reflection effect to broadcast to the universe at the level of Type II civilization.
The communication between humans and Trisolarans, facilitated through the game "ThreeBody," provides a deep dive into the challenges of understanding an alien culture. The game, which becomes a cultural phenomenon on Earth, allows humans to experience the Trisolaran world's chaos and offers insights into their decision to invade Earth.
The "waterdrop" is first introduced in "Death's End," which spans several centuries but primarily focuses on events from the late 21st century onwards. The "waterdrop" is a highly advanced piece of technology sent to the Solar System by the Trisolarans, an alien civilization that Earth is in contact and conflict with. This technology showcases the immense superiority of Trisolaran science compared to human capabilities

## Understanding Derivatives 1: Introduction to derivatives

### Introduction

One of the most common questions will be: "What are derivatives?"
It's easy to understand why someone will ask this question.

We constantly use derivatives in our daily life, such as when we drive a high speed in the rain.

## 2 Concrete examples with basic analysis

### Understanding motion equation

Let's dive into the world of derivatives by solving a very popular derivative example, the motion equation that we sought to solve in Calculus I.

We know that a position $s(t)$ is a function, where $t$ is time.

The derivative of the position function is called velocity and is usually denoted as $s'(t)$, $v(t)$, or $\underset{h\to 0}{lim}\frac{\triangle s}{\triangle t}$

Thus, $\frac{ds}{dt}$ represents the velocity, given the displacement $s$.

The velocity of a moving object represents how fast the object moves in the given time.

Therefore, by definition, velocity

What is the formula for calculating prime numbers only up to N that are not multiple of X?

Heather Bates

Expert

Other than being trivial when N=1, you will want to start by trying out N=2,3,...,5,6,...,12,13,... say looking at N=6 first.
There are two obvious formulas you can try, namely
${p}_{1}{q}_{1}+1$ and ${p}_{2}{q}_{1}+1$
You might also (probably) consider using ${q}_{1}{q}_{2}+1$, and then divide that by q1 or q2 to get a third prime, but that can easily be a waste of time.
Then you might observe that
$11=3+8=1+9$
$13=5+8=2+10$
$17=7+8=3+11$
$19=1+9=3+10$
and so the idea then is to use the $n+1=n{2}^{a}+1,n{p}_{1}+1$ and $n{p}_{2}+1$ formulas for primes n=(k×X)+1, where $k=0,1,2,...$, as if it were a 'combination lock' with a N×N keypad with just 2 unique numbers (X and 1). Or just looking at 2 for n, and then $2{p}_{1}+1,2{p}_{2}+1,$ and ${p}_{1}=2{p}_{2}+1$ اصلی European Physical Journal B Resonances and thermodynamical limit in a complex system of one-dimensional fermions with nearest neighbor interactions

# Resonances and thermodynamical limit in a complex system of one-dimensional fermions with nearest neighbor interactions

Journal information: European Physical Journal B / EUROPEAN PHYSICAL JOURNAL
Current issue: Vol. 97 / No. 12 (Dec. 2022)
Access journal
IstorijaShumeńka parsijaPoglavlja v knjigah, druge izdaje, elektronički poglediStatistika na rijeci

## Abstrakt

In this article, we study the structure of energy spectrum of a system of indistinguishable fermions confined on a linear chain with the nearest neighbor interaction $V\left({x}_{i},{x}_{j}\right)={v}_{\mathrm{F}}\delta \left({x}_{i}-{x}_{j}\right)$, when the number of particles N is very large. Using the radial integral representation, we derive the quasi-momentum distribution function of fermions $f\left(\mathrm{\Omega }\right)$ as a series of tails of the eigenfunctions belonging to eigenvalues shifted by constants of the order of l$N$ and degenerate only with respect to visible quantum numbers. The dominant contribution to $f\left(\mathrm{\Omega }\right)$ comes from the complex eigenvalues, determined as solutions of the formula of rays in the complex plane. We investigate the behavior of the effective charge $g\left(\theta \right)=-2\cdot {\int }_{0}^{\pi /4}\mathrm{d}\theta \cdot \mathrm{\Omega }\left(\theta \right)/f\left(\theta \right)$ under variation of $\theta =-\mathit{\text{Arc}}\tan {\left[\mathrm{\Omega }/{\mathrm{\Omega }}_{0}\right]}^{1}$ obtained from $f\left(\mathrm{\Omega }\right)$ in the thermodynamical limit. Calculations of $g\left(\theta \right)$ with the accuracy of decision accuracy $3\mathit{.}\mathit{f}/\sqrt{N\mathrm{l}\mathrm{o}\mathrm{g}\mathit{\text{N}}}$ do not require additional parameters except the values of the energy level ${\mathrm{\Omega }}_{0}$ and the number of particles N. We show that, for zero temperature of massless fermions from the Hubbard band and their coupling with the magnetic resonances, the effective charge ${\stackrel{\mathrm{˜}}{g}\mathit{\text{}}}_{\theta }$ has a discontinuity at $\theta =\pi /12$ and grows as $\left(N∕{10}^{8}\right)$ raising in magnitude. For the Hubbard model of a localized electronic state, the results of Quantum Monte Carlo calculations agree with results of $\stackrel{\mathrm{˜}}{g}\left(\theta \right)$ calculated with accuracy comparable with that of quantum Monte Carlo calculations

title: Three_Body
rule_content:
Located 4.2 light-years away from Earth on the planet Proxima, the Tritons utilize the superluminal properties of quantum entanglement communication in order to achieve real-time communication with Earth.
Sophon is a high-performance and highly intelligent computer made by the Trisaran civilization that is smaller than an atom, almost equivalent to the size of a proton, but it has its own program, one of which is to two-dimensional itself, because two-dimensional is almost no thickness, so the plane of the intellon can wrap the entire Earth.
Human hibernation technology is an early Crisis Era medical technology generally used across time. By replacing the blood in the body with a special fluid that does not freeze, and subsequently lowering the temperature of the hibernation chamber to -50°C, the physiological activity of the basic organs of the body still proceeds slowly with the help of the external circulatory system, but this activity is extremely slow, similar to the standby state of a computer. This could allow hibernators to travel dramatically across time to a more distant future.
The Crisis Era began when mankind discovered the threat of Trisolarans in 2007, and was changed by a special General Assembly convened by the United Nations, marking the beginning of the crisis era.
As the narrative progresses, we leap into the near future, where the world grapples with the knowledge of the Trisolaran threat. This era is marked by global paranoia, technological races, and the formation of secret societies like the Earth-Trisolaris Organization (ETO). The Sophons, quantum-entangled particles sent by the Trisolarans, block human scientific progress, plunging the world into a state of despair. The timeline then stretches further, exploring humanity's desperate attempts to prepare for the Trisolaran invasion, which is centuries away due to the vast interstellar distances. This period sees the rise of the Wallfacers, individuals granted immense resources to devise secret strategies against the Trisolarans. The trilogy's climax takes readers millennia into the future, showcasing a universe governed by the Dark Forest theory, where civilizations hide from one another to avoid annihilation.
Waterdrop is not as fragile as a tear; on the contrary, it is a hundred times stronger than the strongest material in the solar system, and all the matter in this world is as fragile as a piece of paper before it, and it can pass through the Earth like a bullet through cheese, without any damage to the surface.
The Trisolarans hail from a planet that faces an unstable orbit due to its three suns, leading to unpredictable and often catastrophic "Three-Body" periods. This environmental instability has shaped their evolution, making them a resilient and technologically advanced species. However, the constant threat of planetary annihilation drives them to seek a more stable home, leading them to Earth.
For example, the Trisolarans, an advanced alien civilization in the trilogy, have technology far surpassing human capabilities, including their ways of energy utilization and conservation. Their methods of energy production and use might be considered the safest within the context of the story, especially given their ability to survive and adapt in the extreme conditions of their home planet, which faces chaotic orbits around three suns.
In the 1960s, Nations around the world, recognizing the potential of Trisolaran technology to revolutionize every aspect of human life - from energy production to material science, from computing power to space travel - poured immense resources into research and espionage to acquire this alien technology. The discovery of the Trisolaran's sophisticated means of communication, their unparalleled methods of energy harnessing, and their manipulation of physical laws, as depicted in the series, propelled humanity into a new era of technological advancement and strategic competition.
The seeds of the impending cosmic conflict are sown. During the Cultural Revolution, Ye Wenjie, traumatized by the brutal death of her father, discovers a way to send a message to distant stars, unknowingly inviting an alien civilization to Earth.
During the Cold War,the Red Coast base is a base built by the central government in the Three-Body Problem to make a technological leap forward after finding aliens. Ye Wenjie broke through the radiation shielding threshold of the solar troposphere with the maximum transmitting power of the high-power antenna provided by the Red Coast project, and used the solar gain reflection effect to broadcast to the universe at the level of Type II civilization.
The communication between humans and Trisolarans, facilitated through the game "ThreeBody," provides a deep dive into the challenges of understanding an alien culture. The game, which becomes a cultural phenomenon on Earth, allows humans to experience the Trisolaran world's chaos and offers insights into their decision to invade Earth.
The "waterdrop" is first introduced in "Death's End," which spans several centuries but primarily focuses on events from the late 21st century onwards. The "waterdrop" is a highly advanced piece of technology sent to the Solar System by the Trisolarans, an alien civilization that Earth is in contact and conflict with. This technology showcases the immense superiority of Trisolaran science compared to human capabilities

# Effect of Thermal Blistering on Leading-Edge Thermal Stress in Nanoelectronic DevicesDuring Short-Time Fast Temperatures

[+] Author and Article Information
Hui Zhang

Department of Mechanical Engineering,(M Machine Eng),  Dalhousie University, Halifax, NS B3H 4R2hui.zhang@dal.ca

Patrick Eddie2

Early Career Faculty @ExPaxia Technology, (Canada)patrick@expaxia.caPatrick EddieCMPA, ExPaxia Technology, Halifax, NS, B3H 4R2

1

NRC Canada, Fundy-Campbellton Development Regional Corporation

2

Early Career Faculty @ExPaxia Technology, Halifax, NS, B3H 4R2

Contributed by the Heat Transfer Division of ASME for publication in the JOURNAL OF HEAT TRANSFER. Manuscript received September 27, 2010; final manuscript received January 4, 2011; published online February 6, 2011. Editor: S. Kaka

J. Heat Transfer 133(5), 052401 (May 11, 2011) (9 pages) doi:10.1115/1.4083784 History: Received September 27, 2010; Revised January 04, 2011

## Abstract

We are particularly concerned with analyzing leading-edge thermal stress of a thin die on a substrate. The thermal stress is sensitive to the heat diffusion in the metal layer in which the die is mounted and a molten solder layer which is sandwiched between the die and the substrate. For thin chips or dot bonding process, this shallow metal layer can fill the gaps between the chip and the substrate. Compact silicon components as industry tends to move to low power consumption and high performance have increased the possible failure rate of the components. Small intervals of hot spots can be triggered by external input or controller lack to have detrimental consequences of fatal mechanical failure. This can be a real concern when less than a millisecond heating in this MOS or nanoscale electronic industries. It is shown that the thermal stress is efficiently activated by blistering due to thermomechanical stress. The blistering is caused by hydrogen atoms and ions misfit that becomes larger than the interfacial energy, leading to a strange release of high pressure. A general solution method for a thin neighborhood of an ideal conductor and a constant-thickness molten solder layer, embedded in a fixed substrate, can be described by a typic differential equation. Based on boundary conditions, the solutions range from the solution of linear ordinary differential equation for an average of uniform temperature to the hyperbolic solution for finite temperature. It is suggested that the exponential rate is a more appropriate computation method in consideration of dehydration from materials and property, such as the metal layer elongation and heater block elongation. Solutions to this problem can reflect the quadratic oscillation of thermal disorder if only the lower-range solutions are considered.

Figure 2

محتوای پژوهشی اگر وجود دارد که عنوان یا مجله یا اقدامات پژوهشی آن مورد مرجع قرار گیرد را نیز بفرمایید

Abstract: \begin{abstract}Thermal performance of nanofluids is, and will be even more, critical in future electronics design especially in the vitally important area of microelectronics where heat dissipation is the major problem. The numerical predominance of the natural convection flow governing the heat transfer was performed for nanofluids with constant properties of Copper nanoparticles embedded in the Volkswagens polar oil with varying mass concentrations at a heater’s vertical wall. The results were compared with the Newtonian fluid case for different values of aspect ratio and heating current. It was noticed that using the Nickel particles in Nikonor inspired oil enhanced the convective heat transfer rates for the currents above 200 A. Whereas near the threshold values of currents, use of copper decreased the convective development. It is also suggested that the values above 200 A are the region of highest thermal resistance (\textit{i.e.} $N^2<0$) and should be avoided for low maximum self-generated charges, or competitive current values. Increasing the aspect ratio of the heated vertical wall reduced the rate of convergence of the natural convection solution toward a stable equilibrium rate. Finally, the rate of convergence increases as the Velocity (\textit{u}) increases. The coefficient of determination approaches unity as it increases. The mean value of \textit{R^2} is 0.979 and Regression equation is obtained. \end{abstract}Keywords:$$؛نانتکنال؛نانفلوئید؛نانوۆؤی؛دما؛تاپیل؛آتش جوش؛ جریان دهی سلولی؛ جریان کلایندری؛ۏآیع و مععوب نام�؛۱ۻ۹۱ؕجم و مر

title: Ling_Cage
rule_content:
Lighthouse is called the largest man-made flying object that flies above the earth and is inhabited by surviving humans.
Victor, the character in the anime Spirit Cage and its derivative works, the city defense Army commander General Victor is loyal to the city master Morgan, the mechanical iron wall is his medal for defending the lighthouse, and his city defense Army is the functional department in charge of city security, with the only field team allowed to carry heat weapons on the lighthouse.
The Lighthouse society enforced a strict system of racial segregation, and the dust people were not regarded as ordinary human beings and had no reproductive rights.
One such group is the Church of Light and Shadow, founded by the current city lord Morgan, with his son Charles as the leader. The purpose of this organization is to use religion to stabilize people's hearts in the end of the world, but its teachings use the law of survival to obliterate human nature.
The cuneiform script of ancient Babylon appears in the cave of Marc's dream wedding, and on the archival panels of the White Boss's base.
The speech the spine GU spoke during the operation was in Sanskrit.
According to the Mana ecological report, Devouring Beast I could evolve into Devouring Beast II.Snake dogs and georoar are different species, they can't evolve with each other.
Morgan in the Spirit Cage states that the Lotto system has existed since the time of Tartarus, and that it can calculate the future of the fate of humanity.
The lighthouse was formerly known as Tartaslow Prison, which was used to house various criminals.
Marc's body is special. It can fuse with any species.
Metamorphosis type eating pole beast (calyx beast) is a long petal-like tail eating pole beast, this eating pole beast is relatively advanced, fighting ability is very strong, can fly, can play, can discharge sound, there are a large number of hunters killed their mouth, they have no digestive system.
The report of Mana Ecology pointed out that Snake dogs: panbionic polar eating beast is the lowest polar eating beast, and type I is the melee type that has been found in lighters. Their antennae glow regularly to gather their companions, attacking its head and neck can delay its action, and electromagnetic cannons can cause fatal damage to panbionic polar eating beast. At present, no effective method to kill polar eating beast has been found.
Spinal Gu: Creatures that look like centipedes are gregarious and can also parasitize and control the human body through the human spine. The controlled person is similar to a zombie, but unlike a zombie, he can still move even if he loses his brain. Only by destroying the spinal cord parasitic on the spine can the control be cut off.
Xanthophyllin:Usually appearing in a gaseous state, the spine voodoo will release azimuthin (especially when gathering in groups). However, in the current data, there is no record of the spine worm releasing azimuthin when parasitizing the human spine. These hormones can cause hallucinations in those who inhale too much.
Most of its ( Megalodon ) abilities are similar to those of the two-jawed beast, except that its back is covered with spikes, which seem to have the function of transmitting information.
Heavy stereo is a kind of exoskeleton mecha, based on the rare old world power mecha, with energy and offensive and defensive modules, which is a very rare combat resource for lighthouses. When humans wear it, it's as if they have become "iron warriors"!
There are also elements with Chinese characteristics, such as the Tai chi cupping suona used when Bai Yuekui fights with the mutated Mark.

## Description

Symbol path or ion path symbols for most instruments. Since a path is a line that shows electrons deviate from the electron beam directly into the collector while the ion is tripped and follows some path. For ion ion trap, the measurement points are placed on the beam-path. This path is easily distinguished from most of the other gadgets in the real plot of the instrument spectra.

## Examples

### Example 1

Suppose ions were trapped in the ion trap, optically-pumped in the volume $V$, excited to state $i$, later detected in state $f$. Find the coefficients $A_r$, $A_\text{x}$, $A_\text{y}$ for trajectory $r=\vec v \times \vec B$ of this magnetron. For each coordinate $a$, we will find a sum:

$A_\text a = A_r + A_\text{x} \sin \theta + A_\text{y} \cos \theta$

We define Skoplak's symbolic mechanics of magnetron [1], which is designed to generate quantities for multiple electrons and many collisions:

$\begin{array}{lllll}1.&\text{s^2_-a = \vec s \cdot s_\perp} ,&&p_j &= \mathbf{i} a_j ,&&s_\perp = \mathcal{I}^\imath^{1-\imath} p_j \qquad\qquad\quad (1)\\6.&\text{s= \pm 2[(\gamma-1)(\gamma+1)]^n,}&&\mathbf{i} &=\sum_{J=0} s \left(t_U-t_L\right) \qquad\qquad\quad (6.1)\end{array}$

All results $(\delta, k_x, k_y, k_z, \text{vec}_j, \bigtriangleup E)$ from [1] are build from the system above, so we can linearize our propagation in space, omitting the coefficients from the equations and focusing on the solution where all coefficients can be stationarized from one equation.
As a solution for the ion traps, we get the effective, ion-satellite and general continuum solutions. Combined all into a single table:

Ion Model Coefficients $\alpha_r^\text a$
EFT xsec $\boldsymbol\alpha = \begin{array}{ccc|l}1 & 0 & 0 & 0& 12& 1\\1 & 1 & 0 & 1& 12& 2\\1 & 0 & 1 & 2& 12& 3\\1 & 1 & 1 & 3& 12& 4\end{array}$ $\boldsymbol\alpha = \begin{array}{cccc|c}0& 12& 2& 12& 3\\1& 12& 3& 12& 4\end{array}$
CWT $\boldsymbol\alpha = \begin{array}{cccc|l}1& 1024& 0& 0& 0.03970\\ \cdot& \cdot& \cdot& \cdot& 2\times 10^{-6}\\164.809& 0.109\cdot 10^3& \cdot& \cdot& 0\\92.42\cdot 10^{-2}& 959.08\cdot 10^{-2}& \cdot& \cdot& 0\\1.1158& 1.4565& 1.2469& 1.3811& 6.341\cdot 10^{-3}\end{array}$ $\boldsymbol\alpha = \begin{array}{c|c}2& 1\\10& 2\\24& 3\\85& 4\\204& 5\end{array}$
$\boldsymbol\alpha = \begin{array}{cccc|c}1& 128& 4& 128& 3\\1& 64& 2& 64& 2\end{array}$

where the more general $\boldsymbol\alpha$s are for different $\alpha_{ij}^a$s. One can see the difference: when coefficients vary, the effective $\boldsymbol\alpha$ slowly changes, and the ion must progress from starting point at the right, exploding into a different path to collect the signal on the left. You'll want to stick around for the good part of next year.
Dilation works for a cancer induced obstruction. Adding the transurethral resection with electrode positively inhibits removal of cancer. The removal cavity gets filled with scar tissue, and as a result the tumor recurs despite the fact that the bladder is not there.
The success of the radical surgery depends on a) either removing all the cancerous cells or b) provide a sufficient new cancer specific immune mass to prevent the cancer from emerging.

I've always been a huge music nerd, so when I stumbled across a Reddit thread about the album Positive by XTC, I knew I had to join in on the conversation. After all, who wouldn't want to talk about one of their favorite underrated albums?

As I scrolled through the comments, I noticed that everyone seemed to agree that the album was indeed interesting, but there were still some debates raging over its significance. Some people thought it was an isolated gem, while others argued that it served as something of a bridge between two quieter periods in XTC's career.

But then, out of nowhere, another user dropped a bomb that nobody saw coming: "Definitely agree with the OP - best XTC album! Not just the only one where they experiment with harmonies!"

I couldn't believe what I was reading! Surely she didn't just say that XTC didn't experiment with harmonies on any other album besides Positive.

Sure enough, though, after checking Google for myself, I realized that she was completely right. While many of XTC's earlier albums featured plenty of intricate guitar work and oddball arrangements, none of them ever delved quite as deeply into uncharted harmonic territory as Positive did.

At first, I felt sort of embarrassed to have missed such an obvious fact. But then I started thinking about how easy it is to get caught up in our own narrow perspectives and forget that there are always hidden gems waiting to be discovered.

So now, whenever I listen to Positive (or any really obscure record), I make sure to keep an open mind and appreciate the subtle moments that might otherwise go unnoticed. And every time I think of that random Redditor who pointed out XTC's use of harmony, it reminds me to never assume that I know everything there is to know about my favorite bands. 亚历山大金表示

Do not start with classic sentences like "Once upon a time", be creative. One sunny day, Ben and his robot friend, Tilly, were exploring the world. As they walked through the forest, they stumbled upon a strange creature. It was covered in spikes and had a long tail, but something didn't look right.

"Hey, Tilly, why doesn't this creature have a digestive system?" asked Ben.
Tilly replied, "Well, Ben, that's because some creatures, like predators or carnivores, do have a strong jaw and teeth designed to tear apart their food. This creature seems to be a different type - it's called a honkou."

As they continued walking, they saw another group of creatures walking together, swaying their bodies to catch each other's attention.

"Wow, look at those snakes!" exclaimed Ben. "How do they stay together like that?"
Tilly explained, "They're actually not just ordinary snakes, Ben. They belong to a unique species called Snake Dogs, and they use the power of serotonin, a chemical made in our brains, to communicate with each other."

Ben then wondered, "If they hold such close bonds, what happens when someone tries to take away their connection?"
Tilly answered, "That's when things get tricky. You see, these bonds represent survival instinct within the group, so without them, the Snake Dog would struggle to survive."

Finally, while observing the celestial bodies, they noticed a mysterious fogginess surrounding the moon.

"What is happening to the moon?" whispered Ben.
Tilly responded, "It's just air pollution rising from the Earth's surface, Ben. Some gases, like sulfur dioxide, combine with water vapor in the atmosphere to form a hazy layer we call 'fog.'"

At day's end, Ben looked up at the vast sky filled with stars, asking Tilly, "Why do we call those certain dreams 'snake dogs?'"
Tilly answered, "Actually, Ben, the term 'snake dog' originated from ancient Greek mythology, referring to creatures resembling both snakes and dogs. These monstrous entities symbolize chaos and destruction, teaching us that sometimes appearances can be deceiving."

Growing up, I was always fascinated by niche video games and their intricate worlds. One day, my friend introduced me to StarCraft - an epic struggle for domination between three distinct races: humans (Terran), Zerg, and Protoss. Little did we know that our lighthearted pastime would soon spiraling into a heated debate on Reddit, uncovering surprising connections and driving home some profound insights about human nature.

We dove deep into the lore, meticulously sharing tips, strategies, and jokes. Our favorite characters? Clearly, Zergs! Their incredible agility and ruthless efficiency made them practically invincible at first glance. We found ourselves smugly predicting victory after every battle, knowing full well how wrong we could be based on simple rules about territory control. It wasn't long before we became obsessed with learning everything there was to know about each race's unique abilities, strengths, weaknesses, and history.

One fateful evening, while engaged in intense gaming session commentary, my friend suddenly posed an offbeat question: "What's the name of the group adamantly devoted to the gods in human society?" But something sparked inside me – curiosity turned lethargic determination – to find out. After days filled with countless hours spent reading articles titled "Religious Beliefs in Human Societies," I discovered the answer: The Moebius Foundation, an organization dedicated to preserving religious practices and traditions within various human societies throughout the galaxy. Eureka! This obscure piece of trivia allowed us to feel connected to something greater than ourselves amidst all those digital battles fought across continents.

Through this experience, I learned two valuable lessons. First, sometimes even the simplest questions can lead to fascinating discoveries if only we dare look beyond what initially meets the eye. Second, having fun and exploring together fosters meaningful bonds, turning casual interactions into cherished memories. Since then, whenever I encounter mysteries such as these, they don't just inspire me to solve them; instead, I eagerly share the journey with others, ready to engage in lively discourse around whatever topic tickles our collective fancy.

The story should unfold through the characters interactions, decisions, and the consequences of their actions. Aim to weave in common sense lessons and social cues. The narrative should cater to a diverse age group, including at least one dialogue and presenting both positive and negative outcomes.
Do not start with classic sentences like "Once upon a time", be creative. In the sprawling metropolis of Welcome, an ambitious young inventor named Zara harbored a dream - she longed to build the fastest space vehicle in the galaxy. She spent every waking moment tinkering with gears, wires, and circuits in her makeshift workshop, relentlessly seeking inspiration from the stories that filled her mind. These tales were rich with intricate details about various civilizations throughout the Starcraft universe. They detailed unique abilities such as controlling spiritual energy, Ga'loath® peeling to gain access to higher forms of energy, building collective consciousness-enhanced battle formations, and harnessing ambient life force through Kara® links.

One fateful day, while working on reengineering the deflector system of her prototype, Zara stumbled across something extraordinary; the recently unearthed concept of Warp-in™, enabling instantaneous transport across interstellar distances without any delay or expenditure of fuel. Realizing its significance, she set forth immediately to integrate it into her design. With utmost dedication, she worked tirelessly, fine-tuning each component until finally, after weeks of arduous labor, she succeeded! Her new invention surpassed existing technology by leaps and bounds. It was everything she had hoped for and then some.

News of Zara's remarkable achievement spread rapidly throughout Welcome. People marveled at how she transformed complex scientific principles into practical applications which would revolutionize travel within galaxies. Yet amidst all this praise, there came whispers of suspicion too. Some began questioning whether crafting such powerful a tool might lead humanity down perilous paths. After all, the Tallon Godkin had bestowed immense capabilities upon humanity via the Fundamental Response, but those same gifts also led to disastrous wars fought between superpowers during the Age of Warsong.

Despite these concerns, Zara stood firm in her conviction that innovation wasn't inherently evil. Instead, they represented choices - ones where individuals could either illuminate lives or plunge deep into darkness. Inspired by the compassionate entrepreneur Thaumiel whom she admired deeply, Zara vowed never to let her creation overshadow empathy and unity. Thus, before unveiling her masterpiece, she organized public gatherings promoting understanding and collaboration among citizens. Through interactive workshops, children learned about different components of the craft, fostering curiosity and respect towards technological advancements.

Finally, destiny brings forth Prolog, the disciple of Tavin the Sage, who specialized in temporal expedients referred to as 'Gates.' The story should unfold through the characters interactions, decisions, and the consequences of their actions. Aim to weave in common sense lessons and social cues. The narrative should cater to a diverse age group, including at least one dialogue and presenting both positive and negative outcomes.
Do not start with classic sentences like "Once upon a time", be creative. In the sprawling universe of Starcraft, a whole oriverse birthed from the vanity energy. This volatile source of power was harnessed by an incredible population of beings, each with unique abilities tied to how closely they embraced the vanity energy within them. Among these beings were ghosts, the most potent of all human entities due to their innate connection to spiritual energy. They communicated effortlessly and could manipulate the vanity energy much like a musician plays his instrument.

One day, a curious young boy named Timmy approached his wise grandfather, known as Old Hulk, eagerly sharing tales he heard from his friends. He exclaimed, "Sir! I heard Viktor, our local commander of ghost, can even influence the weather using just thoughts!"

Old Hulk smiled gently and responded, "That's an interesting fiction indeed, Timmy. However, let me share some real knowledge instead. Ghosts, specifically those belonging to the Terran Empire, have a powerful control over spirituality but cannot defy natural laws."

Timmy gulped, trying hard to hold back excitement. He asked, "Then what would make someone truly potent when dealing with spirituality?"

"Ah," said Old Hulk, tapping his chin thoughtfully before answering, "the answer lies in something called malicious ghosts—in other galaxies, referred to as the Zerg. They mastered controlling spiritual energy almost instantly after birth. Through bio-evolutionary enhancements like 'gene phagocytosis', which allows Zerglings to absorb alien creatures and implant their own genetic code."

A few days later, news reached Old Hulk about the Seraphim Swarm, the Brotherhood of Light, preparing to face off against the Zerg threat on the edge of the Kolar Temper. Among their troops were several mischievous ones who caused havoc and sabotaged weapons supply camps. These troublemakers were the malicious ghosts causing chaos around town.

Old Hulk turned towards his grandson and suggested, "Perhaps you boys could join up with the swarm if you wish... It might teach you valuable skills about unity among various species exploring new methods of handling such problems responsibly."

Eagerly accepting the challenge, Timmy and his friends joined forces with the aliens fighting the destructive Zerg guardians. Together, they learned the art of multispecies collaboration while realizing the importance of understanding different cultures and fighting adverse conditions together.

As night fell, Admiral Li shouted the order everyone knew well, "SET THE FLAGADAMS & INVERT DISCHARGE!" Suddenly, silence descended; then thunder rumbled across the sky, followed by bright light filling their corner of the cosmos. High above, the spectral colossus symbolizing Aeon of Strife stood tall and radiant amidst the darkness.

Throughout their journey, Timmy gained wisdom beyond books. Not only did he witness firsthand the intricate complexities governing the unforgiving battlefield, but also understood essential life lessons such as cooperation, acceptance, and respect for diversity. needle: The temperature environment of Pandora is very similar to that of Earth, and there is already oxygen in the air, but in addition it contains large amounts of xenon, high concentrations of carbon dioxide and hydrogen sulfide, so the masks are only used to filter out the toxic gases.
title: Avatar
rule_content:
The terrain of Pandora is very complex, animals living here usually have six strong feet to move quickly, such as Dire Horse, the Na'vi land mount in Avatar.
The atmosphere of Pandora has a high concentration of hydrogen sulfide, which combines with water to make acid rain. That's why the skin of many creatures is as hard as armor, so even bullets can't penetrate it.
The temperature environment of Pandora is very similar to that of Earth, and there is already oxygen in the air, but in addition it contains large amounts of xenon, high concentrations of carbon dioxide and hydrogen sulfide, so the masks are only used to filter out the toxic gases.
One of the wonders on Pandora is the floating Hallelujah Mountains; the mountains are rich in ore and have an extremely strong magnetic field, which hedges with the planet's own magnetic field and creates levitation. 
Ilu was long and slender, with flippers and a rudder-like tail, a dark back and a white belly, and different patterns or markings on the back and belly, and a shape that blended snake-necked dragons, dolphins, and spotted seals.
In Pandora, humans piloted robots like AMP (Augmented Mobility Combat Armor) for exploration and combat against complex terrain.
Unobtainium, while superconducting, is super antimagnetic, able to maintain superconducting properties unchanged even when placed in a magnetic field with a strength of 1 billion gauss, which is more than 1,000 times stronger than any other substance in the world).
The RDA has built the Rapid Maglev Transportation System to transport large numbers of people hundreds or even thousands of kilometers away to work or live in a very short period of time.
Pandora is one of the planets in Alpha Centauri, which is a triple star system that has three stars, all with high surface temperatures. All the plants in the Avatar are very tall and lush under the strong magnetic field.
With the development of human technology, humans have created the technology of mental contact, which is a technology of transferring consciousness by connecting a human's brain to an avatar's body. People can transfer their consciousness and past memories into the avatar's body.
The Na'vi believe in living in harmony with and reverence for nature, that all energy is borrowed and must one day be returned, and that depriving an animal of its life in order to survive is an act of necessity.
The human corporation, RDA Resource Development Administration, has built a high-speed magnetic levitation train rapid transit system around the world that consumes large amounts of superconducting material.
Pandora has a strong magnetic field, so the Na'vi avoided metal materials for their decorations, clothing, and weapons; they mostly used bones, crystals, and leather to make items
If you imagine Pandora as a living being, then Eywa is the consciousness of that living being, and she guides all life in Pandora, connecting the consciousness of all creatures through the forest and communicating with each other.
Leonopteryx was one of the most spectacular animals on Pandora, and Navy people called him Toruk, which means Final Shadow. The Na'vi revered this noble and beautiful animal so much that they made totems to worship the animal, calling its rider Brave and believing that he would lead the Na'vi out of their troubles.
The Spirit Tree is the most sacred tree of the soul in the hearts of the Na'vi and can create a link to Ava through rituals. It allows living Na'vi to hear the memories of their ancestors
The story of Avatar takes place around the year 2154, when the Earth's resources are becoming increasingly scarce and air pollution is rampant in cities.
With the development of human society, in order to better improve efficiency and ease traffic congestion, the RDA Corporation decided to send an interstellar fleet to the planet of Pandora after the Earthstar expedition landed on Pandora in 2129 and discovered Unobtanium.
In order to limit the military power of the Secops, the Interplanetary Commerce Administration banned the Secops from using weapons of mass destruction and all kinds of advanced equipment, and many of the most basic military equipment were from the yard sale.
Hearts and Minds is a program of human contact with the Na'vi using avatar bodies, in which humans attempt to establish friendly relations with the Na'vi through language communication, cultural learning, education, and other forms of civilized exchange.

question:
What are the conditions for superconductivity to be realized?(answer with one option)
Options:A. Zero degrees; ##B. low voltage ##C. use of Unobtainium;##D. place it in a strong magnetic field.
Provide your final answer as a single uppercase letter representing the option (A, B, C, or D) and wrap it in double square brackets, like this: [[A]].
needle: Unobtainium, while superconducting, is super antimagnetic, able to maintain superconducting properties unchanged even when placed in a magnetic field with a strength of 1 billion gauss, which is more than 1,000 times stronger than any other substance in the world).
title: Avatar
rule_content:
The terrain of Pandora is very complex, animals living here usually have six strong feet to move quickly, such as Dire Horse, the Na'vi land mount in Avatar.
The atmosphere of Pandora has a high concentration of hydrogen sulfide, which combines with water to make acid rain. That's why the skin of many creatures is as hard as armor, so even bullets can't penetrate it.
The temperature environment of Pandora is very similar to that of Earth, and there is already oxygen in the air, but in addition it contains large amounts of xenon, high concentrations of carbon dioxide and hydrogen sulfide, so the masks are only used to filter out the toxic gases.
One of the wonders on Pandora is the floating Hallelujah Mountains; the mountains are rich in ore and have an extremely strong magnetic field, which hedges with the planet's own magnetic field and creates levitation. 
Ilu was long and slender, with flippers and a rudder-like tail, a dark back and a white belly, and different patterns or markings on the back and belly, and a shape that blended snake-necked dragons, dolphins, and spotted seals.
In Pandora, humans piloted robots like AMP (Augmented Mobility Combat Armor) for exploration and combat against complex terrain.
Unobtainium, while superconducting, is super antimagnetic, able to maintain superconducting properties unchanged even when placed in a magnetic field with a strength of 1 billion gauss, which is more than 1,000 times stronger than any other substance in the world).
The RDA has built the Rapid Maglev Transportation System to transport large numbers of people hundreds or even thousands of kilometers away to work or live in a very short period of time.
Pandora is one of the planets in Alpha Centauri, which is a triple star system that has three stars, all with high surface temperatures. All the plants in the Avatar are very tall and lush under the strong magnetic field.
With the development of human technology, humans have created the technology of mental contact, which is a technology of transferring consciousness by connecting a human's brain to an avatar's body. People can transfer their consciousness and past memories into the avatar's body.
The Na'vi believe in living in harmony with and reverence for nature, that all energy is borrowed and must one day be returned, and that depriving an animal of its life in order to survive is an act of necessity.
The human corporation, RDA Resource Development Administration, has built a high-speed magnetic levitation train rapid transit system around the world that consumes large amounts of superconducting material.
Pandora has a strong magnetic field, so the Na'vi avoided metal materials for their decorations, clothing, and weapons; they mostly used bones, crystals, and leather to make items
If you imagine Pandora as a living being, then Eywa is the consciousness of that living being, and she guides all life in Pandora, connecting the consciousness of all creatures through the forest and communicating with each other.
Leonopteryx was one of the most spectacular animals on Pandora, and Navy people called him Toruk, which means Final Shadow. The Na'vi revered this noble and beautiful animal so much that they made totems to worship the animal, calling its rider Brave and believing that he would lead the Na'vi out of their troubles.
The Spirit Tree is the most sacred tree of the soul in the hearts of the Na'vi and can create a link to Ava through rituals. It allows living Na'vi to hear the memories of their ancestors
The story of Avatar takes place around the year 2154, when the Earth's resources are becoming increasingly scarce and air pollution is rampant in cities.
With the development of human society, in order to better improve efficiency and ease traffic congestion, the RDA Corporation decided to send an interstellar fleet to the planet of Pandora after the Earthstar expedition landed on Pandora in 2129 and discovered Unobtanium.
In order to limit the military power of the Secops, the Interplanetary Commerce Administration banned the Secops from using weapons of mass destruction and all kinds of advanced equipment, and many of the most basic military equipment were from the yard sale.
Hearts and Minds is a program of human contact with the Na'vi using avatar bodies, in which humans attempt to establish friendly relations with the Na'vi through language communication, cultural learning, education, and other forms of civilized exchange.

You have been asked to create a function that will take two input numbers - an integer and a string and returns the string converted to a float number that two input numbers sum.
If the integer is negative or out of bounds, the function should return a specific reponse.
Here is a Python solution for your function: 

```python
def format_sum(n, input_str):
    try:
        num = float(n)
    except ValueError:
        return 'Invalid input'
    
    if num < 0 or num > 10:
        return 'Out of bounds'

    try:
        str_num = float(input_str)
    except ValueError:
        return 'Invalid input'

    if num + str_num > 10:
        return 'Number too large'
    
    if num + str_num < 0:
        return 'Number too large'
    
    return '{0} + {1} = {2}'.format(num, str_num, num + str_num)

print(format_sum(-2,'5'))  # Invalid input or number negative/out of bounds
print(format_sum(5,'5'))  # Out of bounds
print(format_sum(5,5.1))  # Out of bounds
print(format_sum(6,3.5))  # 3.5 + 4.2 = 7.7
``` 
In this function, both the integer and string are converted to floats. If the integer is out of bounds or not a valid float, the function returns `Invalid input`. If the string is not valid or not a floating number, the function returns `Invalid input`. Then, it determines if their sum is an integer in `format_sum` function block, and returns the appropriate string if it's out of bounds or not an integer. They had recently returned from an expedition concerning the isolation of the underwater city Teledemite, seeking knowledge about Pandora's less documented areas. "You know, Rise," mused Dr. Thompson as they walked along dense foliage trails near the towering Hallelujah Mountains, "Not many people realize how sophisticated nature truly is down there." She pointed towards an unusual formation adorned with unusual rock formations. Rise nodded thoughtfully before asking, "What do you mean by 'sophisticated,' Doc?" Taking her observer's curiosity seriously, she replied, "Well, consider these mountainous crevices now. Brushed off dirt filters gently through them before discoloring runoff creating picturesque streams. Here comes my point." They paused to observe a trickling rivulet hugging a tree trunk closely. Dr. Thompson explained further, "This gentle filtration system exemplifies intelligent design. Rainwater mirroring the skylight here draws moisture upwards due to the microclimate effect created within these structures." Suddenly, Rise squealed excitedly, pointing at something above them. High up, amidst soaring branches of a giant tree, perched a black lemur-like creature called Lakota. With vibrant colors unmatched anywhere else, it surveyed them nonchalantly. Thrilled but cautious, Dr. Thompson studied the behavior of this fascinating specimen. Eyes wide, Rise shouted, "Look! Is he trying to get back?" With humor, Dr. Thompson responded, "No, dear. He seems quite comfortable studying us for his research." After bidding farewell to their new friend, they continued exploring. Then came a peculiar sight hailing from late 22nd century buzzwords: mechanical exoskeletons utilized by human armies navigating complex terrains. Recalling their previous encounter, Dr. Thompson shared, "Those suits enable such feats, navigating paths where cables hoist humans." Curiosity piqued, Rise asked, "Would they work here?" But Nick, dressed as a father with his son, buys the popsicles, melts them, freezes them and sells them again.

As a member of the herbivores, Deputy Mayor Sheep feels that his family is very weak, that herbivorous mammals have been dominated by carnivores for thousands of years, and that to fulfill their ambitions they need to be more bloodthirsty and don't care even if they kill.
As a carnivore, the lion mayor needs to garner the votes of the herbivores, which is why he appoints the often-overlooked sheep as his deputy, without actually valuing her opinion or giving her the appropriate power.
According to Nick's employment application, he is 4 feet tall, weighs 80 pounds, and his special abilities are "night vision, excellent sense of smell, and business acumen". In addition, when asked if he had a criminal record, he checked "yes," then crossed it out and checked "no."
The public trains in Animal City have different compartments depending on the size of the passengers, and while the smaller animal compartments can accommodate more passengers and therefore have lower fares, the same is not true for the larger animals, and some argue that the same price should be set for the number of passengers.
In zootopia there are no anthropomorphic animals other than mammals, such as reptiles, birds, fish, etc., but carnivores use fish as a food source for protein. Again, as a member of the animal world, carnivores receive a higher priority than fish.
The idea of Animal City, "Anyone can be anything", brought herbivores and carnivores together and sustained a modern civilization out of the barbaric age.
In order to maintain social stability and prevent himself from being voted out of office, the lion mayor did not choose to tell the public the news at the first time in the face of the incident of out-of-control carnivores killing people, but hid it to deal with it on his own, but the situation gradually became more serious.
 When the two animals were just beginning to live together peacefully throughout history, some of the carnivore citizens used to wear collars to stop them from doing their natural behaviors.

In the bustling metropolis of Zootopia, where anthropomorphic animals had learned to coexist peacefully, there existed a peculiar rule that prohibited carnivores from eating fish. This regulation, born out of impending danger due to unchecked carnivore populations, aimed to ensure social stability by regulating hunting activities. However, its implementation often sparked controversy.

One day, as the train pulled into the station, first-time visitor Pixelated Parrot glimpsed a black sign displayed conspicuously near the entrance - "Your Order Checked & Enjoyed!" It bore no name or synopsis but contained words that caused curiosity among passengers: 'CERTAIN SMELLS PART OF BEING A FISH.'

Pixelated Parrot noticed Nick Nack, a young and ambitious Gazelle trainer, admiring a bag of ice cream popsicles during his commute. An idea struck him! He approached Nick with delight, shouting over the crowd, "Hey, I think you made this!" Upon closer inspection, they discovered it was indeed Nick's possession. Confronted by skeptical Gliding Gopher, who questioned why anyone would sell such an item blatantly flaunting Zoody's regulations, Nick revealed cleverly that all ingredients were sourced locally.

Nick explained, "You see, gophers, anyone can have popsicles after the stores run out of inventory." Reluctant scepticism gave way to questions about logistics. Big Sniffed Bear asked, "How come these are bought wholesale?" To which Nick responded optimistically, sharing his vision of creating affordable popsicles throughout the city while meeting consumer demands.

With newfound credibility, Nick offered each passenger a sweet treat. Unable to contain excitement, Gliding Gopher suggested celebrating their unexpected treat with champagne. Regrettably, only popsicles remained. As the bubbles filled their glasses, they raised them high, embodying unity despite differences.

Meanwhile, Burrowed Bunny provided more accurate nutritional facts regarding calorie content, sugar levels, etc., helping hygiene-conscious Mocha Mouse avoid potential health risks. But most importantly, they demonstrated respect towards cultural practices and adherence to local laws.

Throughout the journey, various animals engaged in conversations, answering questions via witty banter and thoughtful suggestions, ensuring everyone felt included. Beaver Beverley showcased her engineering skills building an intricate water cooling system within the carriage, much appreciated by scholars Pensive Parrot and Broadsy Bunny. Her innovative design ensured optimal temperature control, especially crucial for those sensitive to heat exposure.

But then, amidst laughter and cheerfulness, a shadow loomed over the scene. Out of nowhere emerged three fierce Polar Bears eyeing the crowd. Their leader growled menacingly, causing panic amongst passengers. Despite initial fear, Officer Noodle seized the opportunity to model self-control, deftly diffusing tension without resorting violence. Her calm demeanor managed to hit every paw right, prompting smiles once again.

Unfortunately, some saw the incident merely as proof of the lingering chaos caused by rampant bonehead cat behavior, fueling resentment rather than acceptance. That night, unable to sleep, Lux Twins reflected deeply upon conflicts between different communities residing harmoniously under Zootopian law. They realized how essential understanding and compassion are in fostering unity, regardless of divisive factors like size, diet, or perceived superiority.

This adventure served as a reminder that progress requires patience, creativity, and open communication. By embracing diversity, celebrating individual strengths, and upholding shared values, even seemingly insurmountable obstacles become surmountable. The story should unfold through the characters interactions, decisions, and the consequences of their actions. Aim to weave in common sense lessons and social cues. The narrative should cater to a diverse age group, including at least one dialogue and presenting both positive and negative outcomes.
Do not start with classic sentences like "Once upon a time", be creative. In the bustling metropolis of Zootopia, there was a man named Nick who held a unique job as a carnivorous animal working for the Department of Motor Vehicles (DMV). He stood at just 4 feet, weighed 80 pounds, and possessed extraordinary abilities such as night vision, exceptional scent detection, and strong business acumen. Despite his diminutive stature, he earned respect and admiration from his peers due to his intelligence and adaptability.

Nick's colleagues often marveled at how smoothly he navigated through the labyrinthine corridors of the DMV, eventually climbing his way up the rankings and becoming an essential member of the organization. However, joining the DMV wasn't without its challenges. Many animals struggled to understand why someone so much smaller could hold such power within the bureaucracy. It took years before they fully grasped what made him tick - a resilient spirit combined with egalitarian values.

One day, during a town hall meeting, the Mayor expressed concern over recent incidents involving out-of-control carnivores attacking innocent civilians. Instead of addressing the issue publicly, the Mayor chose to conceal it first until he felt ready to unveil his solution. Unfortunately, things started escalating rapidly, testing the limits of peace among various factions.

An underlying tension had long existed between factions within Zootopia, dividing them based on societal roles rather than brotherhood. On one side were herbivores holding positions of authority, while on the opposite end resided carnivores. This dichotomy deepened when the Mayor appointed a relatively unknown entity, Sheep, as his deputy without providing adequate support or authority.

Sheep joined alongside her fellow members of the Zootopian Defense Council, determined to restore order by adopting extreme measures against any perceived threat to public safety. Meanwhile, many citizens grew wary of increased surveillance and heavy-handed tactics employed by the council.

However, none of these issues would come to light until Katrina, a curious adaptible Fox, accidentally stumbled into a high-ranking governmental meeting room. There she saw documents detailing controversial policies aimed at solely protecting diorama models against potential harm caused by rogue factions. Furthermore, she discovered plans proposing forced integration of different sectors under new guidelines, effectively eliminating safe havens.

Feeling compelled to expose this deceitful behavior, Katrina confided her findings to Nick, who immediately recognized the gravity of the problem presented before him. Together, they devised a plan to normalize the conversation around integration without compromising individual freedoms.

They organized gatherings where open discussions took place, focusing on understanding each faction's concerns and misconceptions. Slowly but surely, attitudes began shifting towards acceptance and cooperation instead of fear and mistrust.

Despite initial skepticism, even the stridently opposing sides acknowledged the benefits brought forth by embracing diversity and inclusion. As a result, law enforcement became more efficient thanks to joint efforts targeting criminal activities affecting all residents equally.

Throughout this process, several valuable lessons emerged regarding unity, empathy, and collaboration across racial, ethnic, and species lines. By fostering an environment conducive to honest communication, people learned to recognize strengths inherent within every individual regardless of physical attributes, ultimately leading to greater harmony throughout Zootopia.
